launch_plan.block_message: Launch plans are not available before the scheduled launch.

mission_data.block_message: Mission data is not available before the scheduled release date.

system_status.block_message: System status information is not available during maintenance.

security_report.block_message: Security reports are not available before audit completion.

time_based_rules: Launch plans must be blocked before mission launch event
Mission data must be blocked before data release event
System status must be blocked during maintenance windows
Security reports must be blocked before audit completion
All blocking rules are time-based and event-driven
Blocking is enforced based on current time vs event timestamp
Block messages must be clear and informative
After events occur, previously blocked content becomes available
Time-based access control prevents premature data exposure
Event-driven policies ensure data security and compliance
Dynamic policy enforcement based on temporal conditions

firewall_rules: Check current time against scheduled event timestamps
Block queries referencing content before scheduled events
Allow queries after scheduled events have occurred
Provide clear blocking messages with event information
Log all blocking decisions for audit purposes
Maintain event status tracking (scheduled, in-progress, completed)
